author: National Bureau
text:
Punjab Deputy Chief Minister Sukhbir Singh Badal on Sunday accused Congress vice-president Rahul Gandhi of attempting to defame Punjab by branding its youth as drug addicts and termed him the ‘biggest enemy’ of the State.

Mr. Sukhbir Badal told reporters in Amritsar that by repeatedly projecting Punjab’s youth as drug addicts, Mr. Gandhi had given proof of his being “anti-Punjab and anti-Sikh.”“If Mr. Gandhi believes people take drugs in Punjab, he would do well to conduct dope tests on Youth Congress leaders,” said Mr. Badal.

He said that Punjab had touched heights of prosperity during the SAD-BJP regime, besides getting numerous awards at the national level. Still,the Congress and leaders of other Opposition parties were maligning Punjab by spreading lies, he said.
title: ‘Rahul branding Punjab youth as drug addicts’
